result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan T. Marum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:17 AM cases 22CF63 and 22TR458 called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nathan T. Marum in court.  Attorney Michael R. Cohen in court for Nathan T. Marum. 
There is an agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 2 as charged in the criminal complaint in 22CF63. Defendant pleads Guilty to the OWI 1st in 22TR458. 
Court accepts pleas, find the defendant Guilty of both counts. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
As to Count 2 in 22CF63: Court orders court costs including DNA sample surcharge. 
As to the OWI 1st court orders: 
Fine and costs totaling $811.50 plus the Sacred Heart blood draw fee; 6 month driver's license revocation and AODA.

9:38 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nathan T. Marum appeared by video.  Attorney Michael R. Cohen in court for Nathan T. Marum.
Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(9:49 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Nathan T. Marum does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney Michael R. Cohen for Nathan T. Marum appeared in court.
Attorney Cohen advises the defendant lives out of state and Attorney Cohen didn't provide the defendant with the Zoom information.
Attorney Cohen requests new date.
Court sets new date and advises the defendant may appear via Zoom.
Hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Supplemental Demand for Discovery and Inspection
